title: Project-Based Simulation Course for Adaptive Mathematics Learning Environments and Identity Formation

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding of basic mathematical concepts (functions, calculus, statistics)
context.additional_context: Enhancing self-directed learning competencies by reducing social distance between learners and instructors through collaboration in smartphone-based VR simulations for mathematical problem-solving

learning_goals: Learners can solve real-world problems through mathematical modeling in VR environments.

Learners will solve at least three given mathematical problems (e.g., optimization, differential equation modeling) in project-based collaboration within four-member teams, and write/report presentations meeting at least four of five team adaptation strategy checklist items (problem decomposition, resource allocation, feedback incorporation).
Learners develop their identity as mathematics learners through iterative feedback in a simulated environment
Learners continuously monitor their learning outcomes through formative assessments (quizzes, peer assessment, self-assessment)

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
